segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Reports

segment.source: This topic explains how to configure the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Reports feature by using:
segment.target: This topic explains how to configure the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Reports feature by using:

segment.source: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet
segment.target: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet

segment.source: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard
segment.target: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard

segment.source: The instructions are based on the recommended architecture in High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5.
segment.target: The instructions are based on the recommended architecture in High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5.

segment.source: Before you start the configuration:
segment.target: Before you start the configuration:

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: Where to get instructions
segment.target: Where to get instructions

segment.source: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.

segment.source: High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5
segment.target: High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.
segment.target: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology (if applicable)
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology (if applicable)

segment.source: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you plan to configure an MBAM Server feature.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you plan to configure an MBAM Server feature.

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software

segment.source: Review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell if you plan to use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to configure MBAM Server features.
segment.target: Review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell if you plan to use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to configure MBAM Server features.

segment.source: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: To configure the Reports by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To configure the Reports by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Use the Enable-MbamReport Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Reports.
segment.target: Use the Enable-MbamReport Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Reports.

segment.source: To get information about this Windows PowerShell cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamReport.
segment.target: To get information about this Windows PowerShell cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamReport.

segment.source: To configure the Reports by using the wizard
segment.target: To configure the Reports by using the wizard

segment.source: On the server where you want to configure the Reports, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to configure the Reports, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.

segment.source: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.
segment.target: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.

segment.source: Click Add New Features, select Reports, and then click Next.
segment.target: Click Add New Features, select Reports, and then click Next.

segment.source: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the Reports have been met.
segment.target: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the Reports have been met.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Using the following descriptions, enter the field values in the wizard:
segment.target: Using the following descriptions, enter the field values in the wizard:

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services instance
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services instance

segment.source: Instance of SQL Server Reporting Services where the Reports will be configured.
segment.target: Instance of SQL Server Reporting Services where the Reports will be configured.

segment.source: Reporting role domain group
segment.target: Reporting role domain group

segment.source: Name of the domain Users group whose members have rights to access the reports on the Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: Name of the domain Users group whose members have rights to access the reports on the Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: SQL Server name
segment.target: SQL Server name

segment.source: Name of the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.
segment.target: Name of the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.

segment.source: SQL Server database instance
segment.target: SQL Server database instance

segment.source: Name of the instance of SQL Server (for example, MSSQLSERVER) where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.
segment.target: Name of the instance of SQL Server (for example, MSSQLSERVER) where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must add an exception on the Reports computer to enable inbound traffic on the port of the Reporting Server (the default port is 80).
segment.target: You must add an exception on the Reports computer to enable inbound traffic on the port of the Reporting Server (the default port is 80).

segment.source: Database name
segment.target: Database name

segment.source: Name of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Name of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status, although you can change the name when you configure the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status, although you can change the name when you configure the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are upgrading from a previous version of MBAM, you must use the same database name as the name used in your previous deployment.
segment.target: If you are upgrading from a previous version of MBAM, you must use the same database name as the name used in your previous deployment.

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database domain account
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database domain account

segment.source: Domain user account and password to access the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Domain user account and password to access the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: If the value you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a user, you must enter that same value in this field.
segment.target: If the value you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a user, you must enter that same value in this field.

segment.source: If the value that you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a group, the value that you enter in this field must be a member of that group.
segment.target: If the value that you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a group, the value that you enter in this field must be a member of that group.

segment.source: Configure the password for this account to never expire.
segment.target: Configure the password for this account to never expire.

segment.source: The user account should be able to access all data that is available to the MBAM Reports Users group.
segment.target: The user account should be able to access all data that is available to the MBAM Reports Users group.

segment.source: When you finish your entries, click Next.
segment.target: When you finish your entries, click Next.

segment.source: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the Reports feature have been met.
segment.target: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the Reports feature have been met.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To create a Windows PowerShell script of the entries that you just made, click Export PowerShell Script, and then save the script.
segment.target: To create a Windows PowerShell script of the entries that you just made, click Export PowerShell Script, and then save the script.

segment.source: Click Add to add the Reports on the server, and then click Close.
segment.target: Click Add to add the Reports on the server, and then click Close.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: Got a MBAM issue?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
